decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly through aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride. It also includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to control the opponent's board. The inclusion of cards like Guide of Souls and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah helps to provide additional support for your creatures, while Lightning Bolt offers direct damage to control the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and medallions to cast spells that allow for card advantage and eventually combo off with Wish and Past in Flames. By using Ral, Monsoon Mage as a key piece, the deck is able to clear the way for its combo pieces and win the game quickly through a storm of spells. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its fast mana generation and card advantage, while utilizing Valakut Awakening and Past in Flames to keep the combo going even after disruption.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing creatures with low mana costs and aggressive abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By efficiently dropping creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, the deck aims to maintain board presence and apply pressure with cards like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Bombardment. Cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Static Prison help control the opponent's board while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Elegant Parlor provide additional support and consistency. The deck's strategy revolves around swift and aggressive gameplay to defeat the opponent before they can establish their own board presence.

The core idea of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talismans, while also controlling the game with removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Kozilek's Command. The deck aims to summon powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to overwhelm the opponent, while also using cards like Sowing Mycospawn to generate value. The deck also has a land package that includes Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth to support its strategy. Overall, the deck utilizes a combination of ramp and control elements to dominate the late game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw. By denying the opponent key plays with cards like Force of Negation and Counterspell, and removing threats with Fatal Push and Sink into Stupor, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a win condition with creatures like Murktide Regent or Harbinger of the Seas. Thought Scour and Unearth provide card advantage, while cards like Spell Snare and Psychic Frog help to further disrupt the opponent's plans.

This deck focuses on casting aggressive creatures and using burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional mana ramp and flexibility. Leyline cards and cards like Leyline Binding provide protection and disruption. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, using a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells to control the board. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient aggression and disruption to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that can be cycled or discarded to fill up the graveyard quickly. By casting Living End, all creatures in the graveyard are then brought back onto the battlefield while potentially wiping out your opponent's creatures. The strategy is to control the board with counterspells and disruptive creatures until you can set up the Living End combo, giving you a powerful advantage in the late game. Additionally, the deck includes cards that can manipulate the opponent's hand size and cards that can provide additional value when cycled or discarded.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Ulamog, the Defiler using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to help protect the combo. Leyline Binding and Tainted Indulgence provide additional graveyard interaction, while cards like Solitude and Emperor of Bones offer removal and control options. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this Aggro - Hollow One deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Street Wraith and Burning Inquiry to enable the casting of powerful creatures like Hollow One and Nethergoyf for a fast, aggressive start. Utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Dragon's Rage Channeler to manipulate the graveyard and draw cards, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early threats and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tarfire to close out the game quickly. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provides additional value and disruption, while Detective's Phoenix offers recursion and board presence.
